title: 113_hr5042
content: The "Jumpstart VA Construction Act" may be cited as the short title for this Act. The findings section is included in the Act. The Department of Veterans Affairs has aging buildings with facilities deteriorating over time. They manage over 5,600 buildings and 34,000 acres of land, with significant infrastructure gaps requiring billions of dollars to address. The Veterans Health Administration has numerous construction projects that lack full funding. The Department of Veterans Affairs has aging buildings with significant infrastructure gaps requiring billions of dollars to address. The total unobligated amount for all major construction projects exceeds $2.9 billion, and an investment of $23.2 billion over the next 10 years is needed to finish existing projects and close future gaps. At current funding levels, it will take over 67 years to complete the Department's 10-year capital investment plan. The pilot program allows non-federal entities to construct Department of Veterans Affairs major medical facility projects under partnership agreements. The Secretary of Veterans Affairs will conduct a 10-year pilot program partnering with non-Federal entities for major construction projects. Ten projects will be selected for completion, focusing on major medical facility projects that have received funds from Congress and have completed the design phase but have not started construction yet. The Secretary of Veterans Affairs will select ten major construction projects for a 10-year pilot program, including seismic-related, outpatient clinic-related, and other projects. Partnership agreements will require non-Federal entities to obtain necessary permits, with the Secretary providing technical assistance if needed. The Secretary will appoint a non-Department of Veterans Affairs entity for project oversight. The Secretary of Veterans Affairs will appoint a non-Department of Veterans Affairs entity as the project manager for major construction projects under the pilot program. The project manager will develop and implement a project management plan for effective communication. Cooperation with non-Federal entities will be ensured to minimize change orders, develop monitoring metrics, and ensure compliance with Federal Acquisition regulations. The Secretary of Veterans Affairs appoints a non-Department of Veterans Affairs entity as project manager for major construction projects. The project manager ensures compliance with Federal Acquisition Regulations and Department of Veterans Affairs acquisition regulations, and reasonable costs. The Secretary reimburses non-Federal entities for work under the pilot program, with limitations on payments exceeding the agreed amount. The Secretary appoints a non-Department of Veterans Affairs entity as project manager for major construction projects to ensure compliance with regulations. Reimbursement payments are limited until work is verified, and budget requests are made in line with department priorities. The Comptroller General submits biennial reports on partnership agreements, and the pilot program must be implemented within 180 days of the Act's enactment.
